qas.question: In what year did the National Archives announce that it would make its collection of Universal Newsreels available for purchase online?
What company did the National Archives partner with make it's Universal Newsreels available online?
Universal Newsreels dated from which year up to 1967 were made available through CreateSpace?
In what year did CreateSpace begin partnering with Amazon.com?
Who founded CreateSpace and helped them partner with Amazon.com?

plausible_answers.text: reap major benefits for the public-at-large

qas.question: What did Amazon.com think partnering with Weinstein would accomplish?
What can the public view when they go to the Amazon.com website?
How much does it cost to view films on Amazon.com from 1929 to 1967?

context: In July <a0_0><b3_0>2007<b3_0/><a0_0/>, the National Archives announced it would make its collection of Universal Newsreels from <a2_0>1929<a2_0/> to 1967 available for purchase through <a1_0>CreateSpace<a1_0/>, an Amazon.com subsidiary. During the announcement, <b4_0>Weinstein<b4_0/> noted that the agreement would "... <b5_0>reap major benefits for the public-at-large<b5_0/> and for the National Archives." Adding, "While the public can come to our College Park, MD research room to view <b6_0>films<b6_0/> and even copy them at <b7_0>no charge<b7_0/>, this new program will make our holdings much more accessible to millions of people who cannot travel to the Washington, DC area." The agreement also calls for CreateSpace partnership to provide the National Archives with digital reference and preservation copies of the films as part of NARA's preservation program.
